fields.description: I'm an experienced professional with a broad range of skills in communications, media, and web application development. I am proactive, creative, highly adaptive, a very fast learner, and a relentlessly resourceful problem-solver.

As managing editor for the Spartan Daily, I led a move from a proprietary CMS to an open source software stack, including conversion of 10 years of archives. I also co-led a complete redesign and unification of user experience and brand identity across print and web properties

As staff writer and inaugural Multimedia Editor for online production at City College Express, I helped launch a new class to produce the award-winning SacCityExpress.com. I designed and built a new website from scratch, built workflow tools, and trained staff in multimedia production.
At EMRL I implemented version control, standardized our development and deployment practices, and moved from Flash to JavaScript for rich interaction on clients' websites.
I am the lead developer of the popular WordPress Wiki plugin, which has been downloaded over 44,461 times.
I was part of the award-winning team behind WeAllNeed, a journalism and mapping project created for the Great Urban hack in San Francisco.

As editor of Street Sheet, I coordinated a redesign, rebranding and publicity campaign for the paper's 25th anniversary. I co-wrote and coordinated a succesful grant application to fund the campaign, designed a concept and wrote copy for transit advertising to promote the campaign, helped organize and promote a launch event, and succesfully led a committee of stakeholders to define organizational goals and collectively agree on a new logo and design.

Editor of the Street Sheet, a bi-weekly publication with a circulation of 17,000 per edition. The Street Sheet is a publication of the Coalition on Homelessness, which aims to end homelessness in San Francisco while protecting the rights of those who are forced to live on the streets.

Responsibilities include assigning, writing and editing stories; assembling layout of the newspaper; soliciting contributions from writers, artists, and photographers; organinzing writing and photography workshops for homeless clients; creating collaborations with other organizations serving homeless and poor people; managing the social media accounts of the Street Sheet.
Incrementally retrofit Couchsurfing's Rails application with responsive design features. Built new features. Built front-end tools and abstracted design patterns for use by back-end engineers.

Maintained and improved web properties for GAFFTA's initiatives. Designed and built new properties. Architected server infrastructure and improved development, deployment, and version control practices to increase performance and efficiency. Automated processes and reduced external vendors (e.g. moving from three payment processors and two CRM tools to one each) with new software.
fields.company: Gray Area Foundation For The Arts

fields.description: 2011 Summer internship. Added features to existing applications, using Sunlight Foundation APIs, Django, and front-end programming. Created interface for an internal tool using new HTML5 techniques and JavaScript libraries. Gave a talk and tutorial on my work to the organization.

Developed marketing websites for clients using WordPress. Communicated directly with clients to define requirements and create custom software. Implemented performance improvements for existing client sites. Increased workflow efficiency by implementing version control and standardizing development and deployment practices.

Created and maintained print catalogs under multiple brand names using Adobe InDesign, streamlined process to take advantage of new InDesign tools, and created templates to increase workflow efficiency.

Created easy-to-use websites for non-technical small business owners, increased their business' web visibility and provided new sales channels. Provided training in content creation and SEO. Maintained and adjusted sites over time to increase conversion rate.

Edited and assigned stories. Managed team of 12 reporters. Assisted re-design and re-branding of print and web products. Designed and built new website. Architected server infrastructure. Managed story placement and news priority decisions. Reported, researched, and wrote stories. Produced and programmed multimedia and data visualization features.

Reported, researched and wrote stories. Helped launch course in Online Production. Introduced multimedia storytelling techniques to staff and produced first multimedia stories. Designed and built new version of main website. Built web-based workflow tools for staff, improving efficiency and reducing production time.
Brainstormed story ideas, wrote front-page stories, copy-edited pages, and designed pages in Quark Express.
